page.title: 09Newcastle Cen. Restoration
page.content: The conservation of buildings of historic importance is a major factor in the city of Newcastle's attempt to create a city centre community in which people will want to live, work and visit. {Blackfriars,}being one of the most complete{Dominican}priories surviving in England, has an important role to play in revitalising the city centre. It is being restored as the centre piece of an in-town village and houses craft workshops, a restaurant and a tourist information centre. The city {walls}on the fringe of the area add to its tourist interest. Cleaning of buildings in the famous {Grey Street and Grainger Street}has improved the appearance of the city centre as has also the making of pedestrian precincts when the{Eldon {Square}redevelopment took place.
